funcs.name: get_defined_functions
funcs.desc: Gets an array of all defined functions.

return.desc: Returns an multidimensional array containing a list of all defined functions, both built-in (internal) and user-defined. The internal functions will be accessible via $arr["internal"], and the user defined ones using $arr["user"] (see example below).

funcs.name: function_exists
funcs.desc: Checks the list of defined functions, both built-in (internal) and user-defined, for function_name.

return.desc:
Returns TRUE if function_name exists and is a function, FALSE otherwise.

This function will return FALSE for constructs, such as include_once() and echo().

args.name: function_name
args.desc: The function name, as a string.

args.name: autoload
args.desc: Whether to try to autoload.

funcs.name: is_callable
funcs.desc: Verify that the contents of a variable can be called as a function. This can check that a simple variable contains the name of a valid function, or that an array contains a properly encoded object and function name.

return.desc: Returns TRUE if name is callable, FALSE otherwise.

args.name: v
args.desc: Can be either the name of a function stored in a string variable, or an object and the name of a method within the object, like this: array($SomeObject, 'MethodName')

args.name: syntax
args.desc: If set to TRUE the function only verifies that name might be a function or method. It will only reject simple variables that are not strings, or an array that does not have a valid structure to be used as a callback. The valid ones are supposed to have only 2 entries, the first of which is an object or a string, and the second a string.

args.name: name
args.desc: Receives the "callable name". In the example below it is "someClass::someMethod". Note, however, that despite the implication that someClass::SomeMethod() is a callable static method, this is not the case.

funcs.name: call_user_func_array
funcs.desc: Call a user defined function with the parameters in params.

return.desc: Returns the function result, or FALSE on error.

args.name: function
args.desc: The function to be called.

args.name: params
args.desc: The parameters to be passed to the function, as an indexed array.

funcs.name: call_user_func
funcs.desc: Call a user defined function given by the function parameter.

return.desc: Returns the function result, or FALSE on error.

args.name: function
args.desc: The function to be called. Class methods may also be invoked statically using this function by passing array($classname, $methodname) to this parameter. Additionally class methods of an object instance may be called by passing array($objectinstance, $methodname) to this parameter.

funcs.name: call_user_func_serialized
funcs.desc: Invoke a function with serialized function and parameters by calling serialize(array("func" => $func, "params" => $params)), and returns function return in serialized format of array("ret" => $ret, "exception" => $exception). Useful for over-network invocation.

args.name: input
args.desc: Serialized callback and parameters.

funcs.name: call_user_func_array_rpc
funcs.desc: Same as call_user_func_array(), but executes on a remote HipHop RPC server

return.desc: Returns the function result, or FALSE on error.

args.name: host
args.desc: Remote RPC server's address.

args.name: port
args.desc: Remote RPC server's port.

args.name: auth
args.desc: Remote RPC server's authentication password.

args.name: timeout
args.desc: How many seconds to wait for response.

args.name: function
args.desc: The function to be called, same as in call_user_func_array().

args.name: params
args.desc: Parameters, same as in call_user_func_array().

funcs.name: call_user_func_rpc
funcs.desc: Same as call_user_func(), but executes on a remote HipHop RPC server

return.desc: Returns the function result, or FALSE on error.

args.name: host
args.desc: Remote RPC server's address.

args.name: port
args.desc: Remote RPC server's port.

args.name: auth
args.desc: Remote RPC server's authentication password.

args.name: timeout
args.desc: How many seconds to wait for response.

args.name: function
args.desc: The function to be called, same as in call_user_func_array().

funcs.name: forward_static_call_array
funcs.desc: Calls a user defined function or method given by the function parameter. This function must be called within a method context, it can't be used outside a class. All arguments of the forwarded method are passed as values, and as an array, similarly to call_user_func_array().

return.desc: Returns the function result, or FALSE on error.

args.name: function
args.desc: The function or method to be called. This parameter may be an array, with the name of the class, and the method, or a string, with a function name.

args.name: params
args.desc:
One parameter, gathering all the method parameter in one array.

Note that the parameters for forward_static_call_array() are not passed by reference.

funcs.name: forward_static_call
funcs.desc: Calls a user defined function or method given by the function parameter, with the following arguments. This function must be called within a method context, it can't be used outside a class.

return.desc: Returns the function result, or FALSE on error.

args.name: function
args.desc: The function or method to be called. This parameter may be an array, with the name of the class, and the method, or a string, with a function name.

funcs.name: get_called_class
funcs.desc: Gets the name of the class the static method is called in.

return.desc: Returns the class name. Returns FALSE if called from outside a class.

funcs.name: create_function
funcs.desc:
Creates an anonymous function from the parameters passed, and returns a unique name for it.
Usually these parameters will be passed as single quote delimited strings. The reason for using single quoted strings, is to protect the variable names from parsing, otherwise, if you use double quotes there will be a need to escape the variable names, e.g. \$avar.

return.desc: Returns a unique function name as a string, or FALSE on error.

args.name: args
args.desc: The function arguments.

args.name: code
args.desc: The function code.

funcs.name: func_get_arg
funcs.desc:
Gets the specified argument from a user-defined function's argument list.

This function may be used in conjunction with func_get_args() and func_num_args() to allow user-defined functions to accept variable-length argument lists.

return.desc: Returns the specified argument, or FALSE on error.

args.name: arg_num
args.desc: The argument offset. Function arguments are counted starting from zero.

funcs.name: func_get_args
funcs.desc:
Gets an array of the function's argument list.

This function may be used in conjunction with func_get_arg() and func_num_args() to allow user-defined functions to accept variable-length argument lists.

return.desc: Returns an array in which each element is a copy of the corresponding member of the current user-defined function's argument list.

funcs.name: hphp_func_slice_args
funcs.desc: For internal use only, used to merge array_slice() with func_get_args() while avoiding unnecessary copies and allocations. This should not be called directly.

return.desc: Returns an array in which each element is a copy of the request corresponding members of the current user-defined function's argument list.

args.name: offset
args.desc: The offset into the function arguments at which to start.

funcs.name: func_num_args
funcs.desc:
Gets the number of arguments passed to the function.

This function may be used in conjunction with func_get_arg() and func_get_args() to allow user-defined functions to accept variable-length argument lists.

return.desc: Returns the number of arguments passed into the current user-defined function.

funcs.name: register_postsend_function
funcs.desc: Registers functions to call after HTTP response is completely sent to browser.

args.name: function
args.desc: The callback to register.

funcs.name: register_shutdown_function
funcs.desc:
Registers the function named by function to be executed when script processing is complete or when exit() is called.

Multiple calls to register_shutdown_function() can be made, and each will be called in the same order as they were registered. If you call exit() within one registered shutdown function, processing will stop completely and no other registered shutdown functions will be called.

args.name: function
args.desc:
The shutdown function to register.

The shutdown functions are called as the part of the request so that it's possible to send the output from them. There is currently no way to process the data with output buffering functions in the shutdown function.

Shutdown functions are called after closing all opened output buffers thus, for example, its output will not be compressed if zlib.output_compression is enabled.

funcs.name: register_cleanup_function
funcs.desc: Registers functions to call at very end of a web page to clean up and free system resources.

args.name: function
args.desc: The callback to register.
